msg.msgText: "DestinationMappingRule" monitoring data, can be obtained using the "imaserver stat DestinationMappingRule" command. SYNTAX: imaserver stat DestinationMappingRule help imaserver stat DestinationMappingRule <Options> EXAMPLE: imaserver stat DestinationMappingRule "ResultCount=50" "StatType=CommitCount" The valid options are: Name Name of mapping rule. Asterisk matches 0 or more characters. The default value is *. ResultCount Number of returned results. The valid options are 10,25,50,100. The default value is 25. StatType The type of monitoring data returned. Specify from one of the following StatTypes: The default StatType is "CommitCount" CommitCount RollbackCount PersistentCount NonpersistentCount CommittedMessageCount Status RuleType The type of monitoring data to use for selecting the mapping rules. The valid options are: The default value is "Any". IMATopicToMQQueue IMATopicToMQTopic MQQueueToIMATopic MQTopicToIMATopic IMATopicSubtreeToMQQueue IMATopicSubtreeToMQTopic IMATopicSubtreeToMQTopicSubtree MQTopicSubtreeToIMATopic MQTopicSubtreeToIMATopicSubtree IMAQueueToMQQueue IMAQueueToMQTopic MQQueueToIMAQueue MQTopicToIMAQueue MQTopicSubtreeToIMAQueue Any Association Name of associated QueueManagerConnection. The default value is * (which displays associations for all QueueManagerConnections) FilePrefix The prefix of the .CSV file that the result is saved to. The file name contains the prefix, process ID, and timestamp. If FilePrefix is not specified, then the result is displayed on the console. NOTES: 1. Options are specified as "key=value" pairs. 2. All "Key=value" pair must be enclosed within double quotation marks.

msgExplanation.p: This message is the text of a command or an object help.
